intro: Stenocarpus trinervis, commonly known as the mountain holly, is a species of flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and compound leaves. The plant produces small, white or cream-colored flowers arranged in dense, globular inflorescences. Its fruits are woody follicles that split open to release seeds. Stenocarpus trinervis is often found in rocky or sandy soils in coastal and mountainous regions.
